title: Support Moodle calendar
body:
What do you think of the idea of adding support for the moodle calendar?
Since the DSGVO somehow enforces the professors to use moodle instead of the institute's own solution, its calendar contains a quite useful list of assignment deadlines.
I already managed to get the ical from moodle without any user interaction, but I have no idea how to include it into this app...

[MoodleCalendar.java](https://github.com/fsteff/anewjkuapp/blob/56e0f90faabe0ac89cef38e4dda3cc5f6d728a84/aNewJKUApp/src/main/java/org/voidsink/anewjkuapp/moodle/MoodleCalendar.java)

title: Dev
body:

- new map

title: Login is not stored on phone
body:
Login with wrong student number/password returns an error as expected.
When I enter the correct data, I come to the normal screen. But it's not possible to view any data at all. Furthermore the header says: "please login", like no login was added.

With ```adb logcat *:D``` I found some interesting line:

```
03-01 17:11:02.631 21829 21829 I KusssAuthenticatorActivity: finish login to 15*****
03-01 17:11:02.637  2264  3165 W AccountManagerService: insertAccountIntoDatabase: Account {name=15*****, type=org.voidsink.anewjkuapp.account}, skipping since the account already exists
```

But when I looked into the account section of the Settings, ```JKU App``` does not show any accounts added for this app. And the app itself also does not find any accounts to use because the login window is showed at the start.

### System informations

Device: Xperia Z
Android-Version: 7.1.2
LineageOS-Version: 14.1-20190224-NIGHTLY-yuga
LineageOS API-Level: Guava (7)
Current Status of security updates: 5. February 2018
Kernel Version: 3.4.113
SELinux: Strict
Encryption: Yes

title: Timetable is deleted on refresh
body:
Every time the app is closed and re-opened or the timetable is being refreshed otherwise, the whole thing (including the calendar) gets deleted. 
If the app is closed while re-loading (which sometimes takes up to a few minutes) the data from kusss, the calendar stays empty. 
This problem exists since the update in january (i think). 

Also, if one double-tabs the refresh button, two entries per lva/lessonappear. 

Better: incremental update or replace when loading is finished

Edit: It appears this problem exists only on some devices - mine is a Huawei P9lite, running Android 6.0.1

title: Outlook Exchange and JKU Calender goes wrong

The synchronisation between different schedules goes wrong. Schedules from my office which are new are deleted if the app is started. This is a bad bug, because also customers and suppliers are of course informed about the cancled schedule. 
Best regards

title: Grades for courses, that were repeated in other semesters, count twice for statistics
body: When failing a course in e.g. summer semester 2015 and then selecting the course again in summer semester 2016 but it has a slightly different name, and passing, the new grade is counted twice (once for each course) in the statistics. (Example: Algorithmen und Datenstrukturen 1 & Algorithmen und Datenstrukturen 1 (f√ºr InformatikerInnen)

title: 3 ETCS missing
body:
Hi,

I just realized that 3ETCS are missing in your app (and in the excel calculation I made)

The mistake I made was to convert 4,5 ETCS to 4. Could you please check, that you did indexof '/' and not indexof ',' which was causing the mistake in Excel.

Thank you :)

title: wizard
label: [Label(name="Idea")]
body:
use a wizard for setup on first use or even every time the user logs in to his account

screen: description
1. login: login and add some info how to and what user to use
(2. calendar: lets choose the calender where exams and lvas got impoted. local app calendar or others)
3. setup sync: setup sync interval, describe benefits of short/long intervals
(4. setup notification)
5. setup design: light/dark with preview, diagram type, grouping of menus with preview

title: stretch tabs if necessary
label: [Label(name="Idea")]
body:
stretch tabs if they use not the full width of layout
e.g. menus per day: if only (Thursday and) Friday is shown, the tab wont use full with, so stretch tabs to fill width

title: implement rss service for app
label: [Label(name="Idea")]
body:
implement service for app to provide users of the app with important news.

e.g. breaking changes in kusss so app has to be updated

title: change history/notification center
label: [Label(name="Idea")]
body:
just an idea for logging changes and improve/reduce shown notifications

at the moment there are only lot of notifications for exams, events, grades and if on of them is clicked it starts the app and goes to the specific page without showing what has changed.

so what about a notification ceter where all changes (since last visit) are shown.
this will include deletions of events, new exams, registration for exams, new grades, ... and there will also be a marker that shows "unread" changes.

It will also be possible to link from this entries to the specific pages

There will onyl be one simple notification that shows a number of changes and starts the app on the notification center

notification center itself won't be accessible from menu, just from notification.

what do you think about this idea?

title: show notification if sync is disabled
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Show notification if sync is globally disabled or also if just for account sync is disabled.
The update mechanism needs active sync and if it's disabled the whole app won't work properly.
